info.title: Lolzteam Public API: Forum
info.description:
[Market API](https://lolzteam.readme.io)


**API free libraries**


+ [Node.js](https://github.com/NztForum/node-lzt) 
+ [Python](https://github.com/AS7RIDENIED/Lolzteam_Python_Api)
+ [C#](https://github.com/fanidamn/LolzMarketAPI)

**Rate limit**

+ 20 requests per minute (3 seconds delay between per request) If you exceed the limit, the response code 429 will be returned to you.



Clients can subscribe to certain events to receive real time ping when data is changed within the system.
The subscription system uses the [WebSub protocol](https://github.com/w3c/websub) to communicate with hubs and subscribers.


**One Time Token**

Any client can generate one time token (OTT) using existing token. The format for OTT is as follow:

**user_id,timestamp,once,client_id**

With **user_id** is the ID of authenticated user; **timestamp** is the unix timestamp for OTT expire time, the OTT will work as long as indicated by **timestamp** or by token expire date, whatever comes first; **client_id** is the client ID; **once** is md5 of a concentration of **user_id**, **timestamp**, a valid existing token and the client secret. Example code to generate an OTT:

**Configuration**

+ TTL of access token: 180 days
+ TTL of authorization code: 30 seconds
+ TTL of refresh token: 180 days
+ Authorization URI: **/oauth/authorize** (Recommended)
+ Access token exchange URI: **/oauth/token** (Disabled)
+ Token param name: **oauth_token**
+ Token bearer header name: **Bearer**

**Discoverability**

System information and availability can be determined by sending a GET request to **/** (index route). A list of resources will be returned. If the request is authenticated, the revisions of API system and installed modules will also made available for further inspection.

**Common Parameters**


**i18n**

All API requests accept **locale** parameter to switch user facing messages to specified language. The value must be a valid language code (ISO 639-1) with optional inclusion of a valid country code (ISO 3166-1 alpha 2) separated by hyphen ("-"). If no complete match can be found, a language with the same language code (even with different country code) will be used. In the worst case that there are no installed languages of requested language code, the default language will be used. Since api-2015100401.

**Fields filtering**

For API method with resource data like a forum or a thread, the data can be filtered to get interested fields only. The general format is "key.sub_key.deep_key" if you want to include/exclude a specific field. The including rules take precedence over excluding ones.

 + **fields_include**: comma-separated list of fields of a resource. For additional fields, it is possible to use wildcard (*****) to include all default fields before specifying additional ones.
 + **fields_exclude**: comma-separated list of fields of a resource to exclude in the response. Since r2016062001, it is possible to use wildcard as a prefix (e.g. "\*.key") to exclude the field everywhere.

**Resource ordering**

For API method with list of resources, the resources can be ordered differently with the parameter **order**. List of supported orders will be specified for each method. The default order will always be **natural**. Most of the time, the natural order is the order of which each resource is added to the system (resource id for example).

**Encryption**

For sensitive information like password, encryption can be used to increase data security. For all encryption with key support, the **client_secret** will be used as the key. List of supported encryptions:

 + **aes128**: AES 128 bit encryption (mode: ECB, padding: PKCS#7). Because of algorithm limitation, the binary md5 hash of key will be used instead of the key itself.

**Headers**

 + **Api-Bb-Code-Chr: !youtube**: Replace multimedia tags (except youtube) in bb code html with **tools/chr** link. Since forum-2018100301.
 + **Api-Username-Inline-Style**: Return rich username for **username** fields. Since forum-2018052101.

**Subscriptions**

List of supported topics:

+ **user_x** (x is the user_id of the interested user): receives ping when user data is inserted, updated or deleted. The registered callback will be included in GET **/users/:userId** as parameter **subscription_callback**.
+ **user_notification_x** (x is the user_id of the interested user): receives ping when user gets a new notification. Notification data will be included in the ping. The registered callback will be included in GET **/notifications** as parameter **subscription_callback**.
+ **thread_post_x** (x is the thread_id of the interested thread): receives ping when a post in the thread is inserted, updated or deleted. The registered callback will be included in GET **/posts?thread_id=x** as parameter **subscription_callback**.

For supported resources, two **Link** HTTP headers will be included. It is recommended to check for these headers before issuing subscribe request because webmaster can disable some or all types of subscriptions.

`Link: <topic url>; rel="self"`

`Link: <hub url>; rel="hub"`

**Example subscribe request**

`curl -XPOST https://api.zelenka.guru/subscriptions     -d 'oauth_token=$token'     -d 'hub.callback=$callback_url'     -d 'hub.mode=subscribe'     -d 'hub.topic=$topic'`

**Content-Type**

application/x-www-form-urlencoded.

You can import the API into Postman using [this](https://docs.api.zelenka.guru/swagger/forum.json) file.

post.description:
Request API access token using Facebook access token. Please note that because Facebook uses app-scoped user_id, it is not possible to recognize user across different Facebook Applications.

Required scopes:
+ **None**

Request API access token using Twitter access token. The **twitter_uri** and **twitter_auth** parameters are similar to **X-Auth-Service-Provider** and **X-Verify-Credentials-Authorization** as specified in Twitter's OAuth Echo specification.

Required scopes:
+ **None**

Request API access token using Google access token.

Required scopes:
+ **None**

Request API access token for another user. This requires **admincp** scope and the current user must have sufficient system permissions.

Required scopes:
+ **admincp**

Request API access token and associate social account with an existing user account.

Required scopes:
+ **None**

get.description:
List of threads in a forum (with pagination).

Required scopes:
+ **read**

parameters.name: forum_id
parameters.description: Id of the containing forum. Can be skipped if **thread_ids** set.

schema.title: Forum Id
schema.description: Id of the containing forum. Can be skipped if **thread_ids** set.

parameters.name: thread_ids
parameters.description: Ids of needed threads (separated by comma). If this parameter is set, all other filtering parameters will be ignored.

schema.title: Thread Ids
schema.description: Ids of needed threads (separated by comma). If this parameter is set, all other filtering parameters will be ignored.

parameters.name: creator_user_id
parameters.description: Filter to get only threads created by the specified user.

schema.title: Creator User Id
schema.description: Filter to get only threads created by the specified user.

parameters.name: sticky
parameters.description: Filter to get only sticky **sticky=1** or non-sticky **sticky=0** threads. By default, all threads will be included and sticky ones will be at the top of the result on the first page. In mixed mode, sticky threads are not counted towards **threads_total** and does not affect pagination.

schema.title: Sticky
schema.description: Filter to get only sticky **sticky=1** or non-sticky **sticky=0** threads. By default, all threads will be included and sticky ones will be at the top of the result on the first page. In mixed mode, sticky threads are not counted towards **threads_total** and does not affect pagination.

parameters.name: thread_prefix_id
parameters.description: Filter to get only threads with the specified prefix.

schema.title: Thread Prefix Id
schema.description: Filter to get only threads with the specified prefix.

parameters.name: thread_tag_id
parameters.description: Filter to get only threads with the specified tag.

schema.title: Thread Tag Id
schema.description: Filter to get only threads with the specified tag.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of threads in a page.

schema.title: Limit
schema.description: Number of threads in a page.

post.description:
Create a new thread.

Required scopes:
+ **post**

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: Thread title. Can be skipped if **title_en** set.

schema.title: Thread Title
schema.description: Thread title. Can be skipped if **title_en** set.

parameters.name: title_en
parameters.description: Thread english title. Can be skipped if **title** set.

schema.title: Thread Title English
schema.description: Thread english title. Can be skipped if **title** set.

parameters.name: reply_group
parameters.description:
Allow to reply only users with chosen or higher group.
+ **0** - Only staff members and curators can reply in thread.
+ **2** - Everyone can reply in thread.
+ **21** - Local and higher can reply in thread.
+ **22** - Resident or higher can reply in thread.
+ **23** - Expert or higher can reply in thread.
+ **60** -  Guru and higher can reply in thread.
+ **351** - Artificial Intelligence and higher can reply in thread.

schema.title: Reply group
schema.description:
Allow to reply only users with chosen or higher group.
+ **0** - Only staff members and curators can reply in thread.
+ **2** - Everyone can reply in thread.
+ **21** - Local and higher can reply in thread.
+ **22** - Resident or higher can reply in thread.
+ **23** - Expert or higher can reply in thread.
+ **60** -  Guru and higher can reply in thread.
+ **351** - Artificial Intelligence and higher can reply in thread.

parameters.description: Don't alert followers about thread creation.

post.description:
Create a new contest.

Required scopes:
+ **post**

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: Thread title. Can be skipped if **title_en** set.

schema.title: Thread Title
schema.description: Thread title. Can be skipped if **title_en** set.

parameters.name: title_en
parameters.description: Thread english title. Can be skipped if **title** set.

schema.title: Thread Title English
schema.description: Thread english title. Can be skipped if **title** set.

parameters.name: length_value
parameters.description: Giveaway duration value. The maximum duration is 3 days. Required if **contest_type** is **by_finish_date**.

schema.title: Length Value
schema.description: Giveaway duration value. The maximum duration is 3 days. Required if **contest_type** is **by_finish_date**.

parameters.name: length_option
parameters.description: Giveaway duration type. The maximum duration is 3 days. Required if **contest_type** is **by_finish_date**.

schema.title: Length Option
schema.description: Giveaway duration type. The maximum duration is 3 days. Required if **contest_type** is **by_finish_date**.

parameters.name: needed_members
parameters.description: Max member count. Required if **contest_type** is **by_needed_members**.

schema.title: Needed Members
schema.description: Max member count. Required if **contest_type** is **by_needed_members**.

parameters.name: count_winners
parameters.description: Winner count (prize count). Optional if **prize_type** is **money**.

schema.title: Count Winners
schema.description: Winner count (prize count). Optional if **prize_type** is **money**.

parameters.name: prize_data_money
parameters.description: How much money will each winner receive. Optional if **prize_type** is **money**.

schema.title: Prize Data Money
schema.description: How much money will each winner receive. Optional if **prize_type** is **money**.

parameters.name: is_money_places
parameters.description: Enable the distribution of money prizes by places. Optional if **prize_type** is **money**.

schema.title: Count Winners
schema.description: Enable the distribution of money prizes by places. Optional if **prize_type** is **money**.

parameters.name: prize_data_places[]
parameters.description: How much money will receive each place. Required if **is_money_places** is **1**.

schema.title: Prize Data Money
schema.description: How much money will receive each place. Required if **is_money_places** is **1**.

parameters.name: prize_data_upgrade
parameters.description:
Which upgrade will each winner receive. Required if **prize_type** is **upgrades**.
+ 1 - Supreme - 3 months.
+ 6 - Legend - 12 months.
+ 12 - AntiPublic.One Plus subscription - 1 month.
+ 14 - Uniq - lifetime.
+ 17 - 18+ Photo leaks - 6 months.
+ 19 - Auto giveaway participation - 1 month.

schema.title: Prize Data Upgrade
schema.description:
Which upgrade will each winner receive. Required if **prize_type** is **upgrades**.
+ 1 - Supreme - 3 months.
+ 6 - Legend - 12 months.
+ 12 - AntiPublic.One Plus subscription - 1 month.
+ 14 - Uniq - lifetime.
+ 17 - 18+ Photo leaks - 6 months.
+ 19 - Auto giveaway participation - 1 month.

post.description:
Create a Arbitrage.

Required scopes:
+ **post**

parameters.name: as_responder
parameters.description: To whom the complaint is filed. Specify a nickname or a link to the profile.

schema.title: Arbitrage Responder
schema.description: To whom the complaint is filed. Specify a nickname or a link to the profile.

parameters.name: as_is_market_deal
parameters.description: Did you buy account on the market?

schema.title: Arbitrage Is Market Deal
schema.description: Did you buy account on the market?

parameters.name: as_data
parameters.description:
Contacts and wallets of the responder. Specify the known data about the responder (Skype, Vkontakte, Qiwi, WebMoney, etc.), if any.
Optional if **as_is_market_deal** is 0.

schema.title: Responder Contacts
schema.description:
Contacts and wallets of the responder. Specify the known data about the responder (Skype, Vkontakte, Qiwi, WebMoney, etc.), if any.
Optional if **as_is_market_deal** is 0.

parameters.name: as_amount
parameters.description: Indicate the amount by which the responder deceived you.

schema.title: Arbitrage Amount
schema.description: Indicate the amount by which the responder deceived you.

parameters.name: transfer_type
parameters.description:
The transaction took place through a guarantor or there was a transfer to the market with a hold?
Required if **as_is_market_deal** is 0.

schema.title: Transfer Type
schema.description:
The transaction took place through a guarantor or there was a transfer to the market with a hold?
Required if **as_is_market_deal** is 0.

parameters.name: as_funds_receipt
parameters.description:
Funds transfer recipient.
Upload a receipt for the transfer of funds, use the "View receipt" button in your wallet. Must be uploaded to [Imgur](https://imgur.com/upload). Write "no" if you have not paid.
Required if **as_is_market_deal** is 0.

schema.title: Arbitrage Funds Receipt
schema.description:
Funds transfer recipient.
Upload a receipt for the transfer of funds, use the "View receipt" button in your wallet. Must be uploaded to [Imgur](https://imgur.com/upload). Write "no" if you have not paid.
Required if **as_is_market_deal** is 0.

parameters.name: as_tg_login_screenshot
parameters.description:
Screenshot showing the respondent's Telegram login.
If the correspondence was conducted in Telegram, upload a screenshot that will display the respondent's Telegram login against the background of your dialogue. The screenshot must be uploaded to [Imgur](https://imgur.com/upload). If the correspondence was conducted elsewhere, write "no".

schema.title: Arbitrage Screenshot
schema.description:
Screenshot showing the respondent's Telegram login.
If the correspondence was conducted in Telegram, upload a screenshot that will display the respondent's Telegram login against the background of your dialogue. The screenshot must be uploaded to [Imgur](https://imgur.com/upload). If the correspondence was conducted elsewhere, write "no".

+ **22** - Resident or higher can reply in thread.
+ **23** - Expert or higher can reply in thread.

post_body.title: Post Body
post_body.description:
You should describe what's happened.
- describe the situation in a nutshell. If you wish, you can describe the situation in more detail using the "Spoiler" function.
- attach screenshots of correspondence. You must upload to the site [Imgur](https://imgur.com/upload) - for convenience, use Ctrl + V when uploading screenshots to the album.
- other evidence;
- notify the respondent about the complaint you created, familiarize him with hidden content

Describe the situation in as much detail as possible.

twitter_uri.title: Twitter Uri

post.title: Post

alert.title: Alert

email.title: Email

message.title: Message
message.default: A password reset request has been emailed to you. Please follow the instructions in that email.

id.title: Id
id.description: identifier for the job, will be use in output as key of a result set. If this parameter is not set, the URI will be used.

uri.title: Uri
uri.description: URI of the API request to execute.

method.title: Method
method.description: HTTP method of the API request to execute. If this parameter is not set, GET HTTP method will be used.

BatchJobParams.title: Params
BatchJobParams.description: parameters of the API request to execute.
